title: If we're finally gonna address the afk issue can we give afk's increased exp and gold generation?
body:
So that if they DO come back into the game they can be an immediate help to their team? 

Obviously it would only start after a set minutes of not being a part of the game (like fully disconnected) and it would still have to be less than if they were ACTUALLY a part of the game the entire time, but this is a really good way to help the problem.

I'd rather wait on my afk in the hopes he comes back to help rather than just try to surrender before the 20 minute mark lmao

replies.body: Not to mention it doesn't even make sense that the premade gets a loss on the /remake. If it's a loss for them either way WHY would they even bother to surrender? And in dynamic queue were premades are more common and can be larger than 2, it makes it even worse.

The point is that if premades are not punished along with their AFK team member, they could abuse it by picking one of their members to go AFK. The way it's shaping up, the worse case is that the premade with the AFK simply refuses to remake the game, and it continues as it would without the remake system.

If this did happen, I see another "ZZ'Rot" problem.  What if I am behind?  "oh, increased gold and Exp. for afks!"  Afk's for 10 minutes.

Riot should NEVER reward AFKs with anything.  If you do not have time to sit down and play for 60 minutes, do not queue.  If you do not have a good internet connection, do not queue in ranked.
